Joshi wrote lyrics about the mother and son playing hide-and-seek, which is portrayed as a metaphor for the sad reality of the son being hidden forever. The song Khalbali from the soundtrack 'Roja' depicts this concept.
The song Luka Chuppi from the soundtrack 'Roja' was considered for an Academy Award for Best Original Song nomination.

In the soundtrack 'Roja', Rahman integrated traditional Punjabi cultural elements such as a woman's prayer at the Sikh Gurdwara (Golden Temple) and the bhangra harvest dance alongside more contemporary, global styles such as hard rock and hip hop to depict the cosmopolitan lifestyle of the youngsters in the film.
